= objcount =

== Syntax ==
integer '''objcount'''(zone : zoneptr);

== Description ==
The '''objcount'''() function returns the number of objects defined in a specific zone. This field provides access to the count of objects that belong to the specified zone.

Based on the C implementation, this function operates on a zone pointer and calls the `getNumOfObjects()` method to retrieve the object count for that zone.

== Parameters ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Parameter !! Type !! Description
|-
| zone || zoneptr || Pointer to the zone to query for object count
|}

== Return Value ==
Returns integer:
* '''integer''' - Number of objects defined in the specified zone
* '''fail''' - If the zone pointer is null or invalid

== Field Access ==
This is actually a field access on a zoneptr, not a standalone function. The proper syntax is:
 zone.objcount

== Availability ==
This field is available on zoneptr type.

== Examples ==
=== Basic Usage ===
 dilbegin zone_object_info();
 var
    current_zone : zoneptr;
    obj_num : integer;
 
 code
 {
    current_zone := zhead();
    
    while (current_zone != null)
    {
       obj_num := current_zone.objcount;
       act("Zone $1t has $2d objects", A_ALWAYS, self, obj_num, current_zone, TO_CHAR);
       current_zone := current_zone.next;
    }
 } dilend

=== Zone Analysis ===
 dilbegin analyze_zone(zone_name : string);
 var
    target_zone : zoneptr;
    obj_count : integer;
 
 code
 {
    target_zone := findzone(zone_name);
    
    if (target_zone == null)
    {
       act("Zone '$1t' not found.", A_ALWAYS, self, zone_name, null, TO_CHAR);
       return;
    }
    
    obj_count := target_zone.objcount;
    act("Zone '$1t' contains $2d objects", A_ALWAYS, self, obj_count, target_zone, TO_CHAR);
 } dilend

=== Comprehensive Zone Report ===
 dilbegin zone_report();
 var
    z : zoneptr;
    total_objs : integer;
 
 code
 {
    total_objs := 0;
    z := zhead();
    
    act("=== Zone Object Report ===", A_ALWAYS, self, null, null, TO_CHAR);
    
    while (z != null)
    {
       act("Zone: $1t - Objects: $2d", A_ALWAYS, self, z.objcount, z, TO_CHAR);
       total_objs := total_objs + z.objcount;
       z := z.next;
    }
    
    act("Total objects across all zones: $1d", A_ALWAYS, self, total_objs, null, TO_CHAR);
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* This field is currently marked as obsolete and not used in any DIL programs
* The count includes all objects defined in the zone's file, regardless of whether they are currently loaded
* Use with [[findzone]] to get a zone pointer by name
* Combine with [[roomcount]] and [[npccount]] for complete zone statistics

== Error Handling ==
Always check the zone pointer for null before accessing objcount:

 if (zone_ptr != null)
 {
    count := zone_ptr.objcount;
 }
 else
 {
    act("Invalid zone pointer.", A_ALWAYS, self, null, null, TO_CHAR);
 }
